item.title: Remembering the Jamaica Motel: A Vintage Las Vegas Strip Memory
item.description:
A Slice of Strip Simplicity: The Jamaica Motel

The Las Vegas Strip wasn’t always dominated by sprawling mega-resorts and themed hotels. In the early 1960s, a different kind of lodging thrived â€“ the roadside motor court. These were simple, affordable havens for travelers, offering a convenient and welcoming place to rest after a long drive. Among these, the Jamaica Motel stood out, a familiar landmark at 3745 South Las Vegas Boulevard, just south of Tropicana Avenue.
